title: Roadtrip in South England (where to go/what to see)

posts.content:
Hy,

very lastminute another holiday got cancelled,
so I would like to do a little tour of the south part of England.
Anybody knows any good websites/links/threads from people who have done it before?
Looking to tour around 5 days, don't plan on driving to much miles since our little boy (9months) will travel along.
Also since the camping interior isn't really laid out well, we won't stay on campsides to much, more plan on using small little hotels...

Thxs for any advise!
Tanguy

Sancho wrote:
Also since the camping interior isn't really laid out well, we won't stay on campsides to much, more plan on using small little hotels...



Remove the rotor arm and maybe the lead from the dizzy to the coil then as lots of buses go missing in the UK

Hi Tanguy,
What kind of things are you looking to do? Beaches? Citys? Shopping? History? Scenery?
The South of England is beautiful & interesting (in parts!).
Not sure where you're sailing into but the New Forest area is stunning, plenty to see & do.
Give us a clue & I'm sure people will be able to recommend places to go depending on which areas you're aiming for!
Debs

most interested in old stuff
I've got stonehenge allready on my list,
and some old little town's would be nice aswell.
Also some old castles...
Pretty twisting roads and scenerys are always good aswell
A trip to the beach can be fun, but only if the weather is really good.
A nice lake probably is even better

You see I'am not picky

Thinking of bringing a big chain aswell to secure the bus around anything firm enough

Arundel and it's Castle are worth seeing. Nice little town just down the road from me. Beaulie is worth a look too if you venture into the new forest. Museum and house.

http://www.beaulieu.co.uk/

http://www.arundel.org.uk/

Nick

I can recommend Avebury in Wiltshire as well if you're interested in Stonehenge (more hands on, bigger & less touristy).
Also Bath is beautiful City & full of history & interesting things to do (Roman baths, cool shops, interesting architecture) . There are a couple of good castles. Corfe castle is good (rat look castle!) & there are a couple of nice beaches & good walks nearby (Lulworth cove, Durdle door). The historic docks in Portsmouth are also good for a look round.
Personally I wouldn't be too worried about having your van stolen, just be sensible, park somewhere safe & well lit & have some sort of deterent, steering wheel lock etc.
Hope you have a fantastic trip, I'll PM you my number if you have any problems give me a shout & hopefully I can point you in the right direction!

If you are getting the ferry to Dover then travel west you will get to Hastings which is where the Normans invaded in 1066, just down the road is pevensey castle and herstmonceux castle and battle abbey. Then a bit further along is Brighton which is a popular tourist spot with a decent beach (if you like stoney beaches) if you like sandy beaches then camber sands is nice and is a short drive from Dover on the way to Hastings.

thxs for all the good tips!
I'll take some time saturday to map it out and prepare the van a bit
Still have to convince my wife a bit...
That will work out eventually.

Thxs aswell for the pm Ambubird! Just to kind!

Sincerly
Tanguy

did a very quick drawing
route will look like this
Google Maps

Anything specific to see between Dover and Arundel?

Thxs for the help, vey much appreciate it!
Tanguy
